HOST.description: Change this to the hostname you expect the application to have. If you want to use the one heroku provides you, you need to deploy and then change it in the applicaton settings. If you provided an App Name, then it will be appname.herokuapp.com (be aware, this should not include http:// only appname.herokuapp.com

EMAIL.description: Email address used to send registration emails, etc.

SMTP_USER.description: Username for the SMTP server you want to use.

SMTP_HOST.description: Hostname of the SMTP server you want to use.

SMTP_PORT.description: Port of the SMTP server you want to use.

SMTP_DOMAIN.description: Domain you want to send your emails to be sent from.

GITHUB_CLIEND_ID.description: Client ID of your GitHub Application. Tip: you will need to register you application with the callback url <PROTOCOLL>://<HOST>/users/auth/github/callback. As stated in the HOST parameter already, if you don't know the url yet then deploy and update the GitHub application once you do know.

GITHUB_CLIEND_SECRET.description: Client Secret of your GitHub Application.

SESSION_SECRET.description: Your applications session secret to ensure the integrity of your cookies.

PEPPER.description: Add some pepper to your salt.
